Layer Mutations onto the ARG for Each Loci

Source: R/mutation_model.R
layer_mutations_on_ARG.Rd

Layer Mutations onto the ARG for Each Loci

layer_mutations_on_ARG(mutationrate, ARG)

Arguments

mutationrate

numeric; the genome-wide per-generation mutation rate
ARG

set of bvtree; a set of bvtrees

Value

hapmat numeric matrix; a matrix of mutliallelic haplotypes for each parasite considered. Loci are in rows and parasites (haplotypes) are in columns.

Details

The mutation model approximates an infinite allele model in time which is then collapsed into a single loci. Mutations are drawn with respect to the mutation rate and overall tree length from a poisson model. Mutations are then "droppped" onto the tree following a uniform distribution. Mutations that happen upstream (i.e. are ancestral) are carried along the tree branch to produce the final haplotypes for each parasite node.

Contents

Developed by Nick Brazeau, Bob Verity.
